016package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day08;
017
018import static com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.Presentation.NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT;
019
020import com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.DataSource;
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.util.Map;
023import java.util.function.Predicate;
024import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
025import java.util.regex.Matcher;
026import java.util.regex.Pattern;
027import java.util.stream.Collectors;
028import java.util.stream.Stream;
029
030/**
031 * Implements solutions for both parts of day 8, reading an input file with the first line
032 * specifying a sequence of left and right turns, and subsequent lines specifying a directed graph,
033 * with each line containing a node label and the labels of the nodes adjacent in the left and right
034 * directions.
035 * <p>After reading the input data, parts 1 and 2 differ significantly in the computations required.
036 * Though they share the common element of counting the steps from an initial node to a terminal
037 * node, the initial node in part 1 is the node with the label "AAA", and the terminal node is
038 * "ZZZ"; for part 2, <em>all</em> nodes with labels ending in "A" are initial nodes, and all nodes
039 * with labels ending in "Z" are <em>potential</em> terminal nodes. Further, in part 2, traversal
040 * begins at <em>all</em> initial nodes and proceeds in parallel, until all of these paths reach a
041 * terminal node <em>in the same step</em> (paths may pass through terminal nodes multiple times).
042 *
043 * @see <a href="https://adventofcode.com/2023/day/8">"Day 8: Haunted Wasteland"</a>.
044 */
045public class HauntedWasteland {
046
047  private static final String ORIGIN_NAME = "AAA";
048  private static final String DESTINATION_NAME = "ZZZ";
049  private static final String ORIGIN_INDICATOR = "A";
050  private static final String DESTINATION_INDICATOR = "Z";
051  private static final Pattern NODE_EXTRACTOR =
052      Pattern.compile("^(\\S+)\\s+=\\s*\\((\\S+)\\s*,\\s*(\\S+)\\)\\s*$");
053
054  private final String moves;
055  private final Map<String, Node> nodes;
056  private final Map<Character, UnaryOperator<Node>> navigator = Map.of(
057      'L', Node::getLeft,
058      'R', Node::getRight
059  );
060
061  /**
062   * Initializes this instance, using the value of {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} as the name
063   * (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read. In other
064   * words, using this constructor is equivalent to using
065   * {@link #HauntedWasteland(String) HauntedWasteland(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE)}.
066   *
067   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}} cannot be
068   *                     found or read.
069   */
070  public HauntedWasteland() throws IOException {
071    this(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE);
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Initializes this instance, using the value specified in the {@code inputFile} parameter as the
076   * name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, parsing
077   * the left and right turn sequence at the start of the file, then parsing each successive line as
078   * a node label, followed by a pair of labels for the adjacent nodes in the left and right
079   * directions.
080   *
081   * @param inputFile Classpath/package-relative location of file from which input is read.
082   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@code inputFile} cannot be found or read.
083   */
084  public HauntedWasteland(String inputFile) throws IOException {
085    try (Stream<String> lines = DataSource.simpleLines(inputFile, this)) {
086      StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
087      nodes = lines
088          .map(NODE_EXTRACTOR::matcher)
089          .peek((matcher) -> builder.append(matcher.matches() ? "" : matcher.replaceAll("")))
090          .filter((Matcher::matches))
091          .collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableMap(
092              (matcher) -> matcher.group(1),
093              (matcher) -> new Node(matcher.group(1), matcher.group(2), matcher.group(3))));
094      moves = builder.toString();
095      nodes
096          .values()
097          .forEach((node) -> node.resolve(nodes));
098    }
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of {@link HauntedWasteland}, invokes the
103   * relevant solution method, and prints the result.
104   *
105   * @param args Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
106   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}} cannot be
107   *                     found or read.
108   */
109  public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
110    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 1, new HauntedWasteland().countSteps());
111    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 2, new HauntedWasteland().countParallelSteps());
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Counts and returns the number of steps required to travel from a single initial node (labeled
116   * as "AAA") to a single destination node ("ZZZ").
117   */
118  public long countSteps() {
119    return countSteps(nodes.get(ORIGIN_NAME),
120        (Node node) -> node.getName().equals(DESTINATION_NAME));
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Counts and returns the number of steps required to travel from <em>all</em> initial nodes
125   * (with labels ending in as "A") to destination nodes (with labels ending in "Z"), such that if
126   * one or more paths arrive at a destination node before the rest, travel continues on from that
127   * destination node, until <em>all</em> paths arrive at destination nodes in the same step.
128   * <p>Implementation notes:</p>
129   * <ul>
130   *   <li>While not stated explicitly in the instructions, this implementation assumes (inferring
131   *   from the example given) that after reaching a terminal node from a given initial node the
132   *   first time, it will take the same number of steps to reach the same (or another) terminal
133   *   node again.</li>
134   *   <li>No assumption is made regarding the coprimality (or not) of the length of the sequence of
135   *   left-right turns and the number of steps required to reach a terminal node from any of the
136   *   initial nodes.</li>
137   * </ul>
138   * <p>Given the above, the solution approach followed in this implementation is simply to compute
139   * the least common multiple (LCM) of the length of the left-right turn sequence and the numbers
140   * of steps required to reach terminal nodes from all of the initial nodes separately.</p>
141   */
142  public long countParallelSteps() {
143    return nodes
144        .entrySet()
145        .stream()
146        .filter((entry) -> entry.getKey().endsWith(ORIGIN_INDICATOR))
147        .mapToLong((entry) ->
148            countSteps(entry.getValue(), (node) -> node.getName().endsWith(DESTINATION_INDICATOR)))
149        .reduce(moves.length(), this::lcm);
150  }
151
152  private long countSteps(Node from, Predicate<Node> destinationCheck) {
153    char[] moves = this.moves.toCharArray();
154    int moveIndex = 0;
155    long count = 0;
156    for (Node node = from; !destinationCheck.test(node); ) {
157      node = navigator.get(moves[moveIndex]).apply(node);
158      moveIndex = (moveIndex + 1) % moves.length;
159      count++;
160    }
161    return count;
162  }
163
164  private long lcm(long a, long b) {
165    return a * b / gcd(a, b);
166  }
167
168  private long gcd(long a, long b) {
169    return (b == 0) ? Math.abs(a) : gcd(b, a % b);
170  }
171
172  private static class Node {
173
174    private final String name;
175    private final String leftName;
176    private final String rightName;
177
178    private Node left;
179    private Node right;
180
181    public Node(String name, String leftName, String rightName) {
182      this.name = name;
183      this.leftName = leftName;
184      this.rightName = rightName;
185    }
186
187    public void resolve(Map<String, Node> nodeNames) {
188      left = nodeNames.get(leftName);
189      right = nodeNames.get(rightName);
190    }
191
192    public String getName() {
193      return name;
194    }
195
196    public Node getLeft() {
197      return left;
198    }
199
200    public Node getRight() {
201      return right;
202    }
203
204  }
205
206}
